answers.question: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.

answers.answer: Open-source software must be connected to the real-world in order for its ecosystem to grow. The Regen Atlas, by providing an open-source overview of all of the green tokenized assets that exist, kills two birds with one stone: first, by practicing what it preaches and developing itself in an OSS fashion, and secondly, by illuminating for real-world communities the powerful OSS applications built on blockchain that can benefit them and their material environments. This is a strong pull factor for recruiting and expanding the OSS pie.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer:
The Regen Atlas handles the following use cases:

- Listing of green crypto-assets (and a custom, modernized taxonomy of green crypto) in a geo-interface, whose real-world properties is uncommon in Web3 development.
- Aggregation of certifications for green crypto-assets. Certifiers represent a group of stakeholders who give assets certifications by verifying their material impact in the world. Carbon credits have Certifications like Redd+ that attest to the quality of the carbon vintage. Similarly, sustainable tokenized commodities could have an organic certification that acknowledges them as being produced in a regenerative, non-chemical way.
- Decentralized purchase of green crypto-assets on the Celo blockchain (to be expanded to more blockchains)
answers.question: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?

answers.answer:
There are three critical milestones that are part of our next sprint:

1. Rehauling our Taxonomy

The current Regen Atlas green crypto-asset taxonomy is somewhat dated given innovation in the sector and our evolving understanding of green finance nomenclature. With proceeds from this round, we will update the taxonomy and all corresponding database entries in our aggregator.

2. A Green Crypto-Asset Market Metrics Dashboard


Work has already begun on this project. Essentially, we are building a dashboard to track the growth of green crypto-assets in real-time, using our database as reference and plugging into existing APIs such as Coingecko. By tracking the market size of the green crypto-asset sector, we can prove real growth and help drive investment towards it.

3. Addition of Organizations

Recently, there has been an explosion in projects leveraging Web3 to do regenerative and sustainable work, such as Celo Regional DAOs, Greenpill Network and ReFi DAO chapters, and more. We plan to add all of these Orgs and their respective nodes to the Regen Atlas, to better understack the growing Web3 localist ecosystem.
answers.question: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

answers.answer: n/a ‚Äî all smart contracts used by the Regen Atlas dApp are used from other existing projects, such as Uniswap and EcoBridge, with Regen Atlas providing a front-end.
answers.question: For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]‚Äîfor example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Regen Atlas üåç
project.description:
Regen Atlas is an open-source platform consolidating diverse green crypto-assets and stakeholders into a single, accessible interface. By enhancing transparency, reliability, and innovation, we empower users to navigate and engage with the green cryptoeconomy effectively.

---

## ‚ú® TL;DR

Regen Atlas is a **public good** that aggregates the entire green crypto value chain.

For this GG23 round, we‚Äôve made significant advancements, including:
- Expanding our database to **over 250 green crypto-assets**.
- Developing an **admin panel** for streamlined backend management.

[View project on KarmaGAP](https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/regen-atlas-)

## üëÄ Vision

The climate crisis demands **trillions in funding**, yet traditional green finance remains inefficient. Current challenges include:

- **Low trust and accessibility** in green asset markets due to quality and reliability concerns.
- **Slow adoption** of green crypto assets compared to other sectors.
- **Heavy reliance on intermediaries**, reducing monetization and innovation.
- **Overemphasis on carbon**, neglecting other critical green assets (e.g., biodiversity credits).
- **Lack of innovative financial instruments** (e.g., futures, indexes, green asset-backed stablecoins) to drive liquidity.

‚û°Ô∏è **Regen Atlas is transforming this landscape** by providing an open-source platform for individuals and organizations to discover, trade, and access green crypto-assets. ‚¨ÖÔ∏è

## üó∫Ô∏è Solution: Regen Atlas

Regen Atlas is a **location-based green crypto-asset aggregator** that addresses market inefficiencies by consolidating **all existing green crypto assets** and their respective value chains.

### Key Features:
‚úÖ **Support for Diverse Green Assets** ‚Äì Access to a broad spectrum of green crypto assets, including biodiversity credits, agricultural tokens, solar bonds, and forward commodity contracts.

‚úÖ **Aggregated Certifications** ‚Äì Ratings from multiple certifiers in one place, enabling users to assess asset quality and impact with confidence.

## ‚úÖ Progress Since Last Round

Since our last update, Regen Atlas has made significant progress:

üìà **Database Expansion** ‚Äì Grew from **124 to 251 assets** across **20 different providers**, with **new listing requests frequently coming in**.

üõ†Ô∏è **Admin Panel Development** ‚Äì Enhanced backend functionality to **easily manage, add, remove, and modify assets**, including certifier integrations.

üìö **Updated Documentation** ‚Äì GitBook documentation has been refreshed to reflect all platform changes.

üü¢ **EcoBridge Credit Retirement** ‚Äî Some green crypto-assets now have a [credit retirement feature](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/assets/41ce845c-2ae8-497f-b1a3-0caa11aceae7), powered by EcoBridge.

## üßë‚Äçüíª Roadmap & Future Plans

With your support, Regen Atlas will achieve the following milestones:

- üìå **Taxonomy Update** ‚Äì We are already working on a new asset classification that we aim to finish soon. This updated classification streamlines the current taxonomy to be more intuitive and aligned with traditional sustainability metrics.
- üìä **Market Cap Dashboard** ‚Äì Work has been started to provide users with real-time insights into market statistics based on the updated taxonomy, and shall continue thanks to your support. With this, we‚Äôll be able to track the growth of the green crypto-asset sector.
- üéã **Org Filter** ‚Äî Expanding beyond assets and issuers, our next major feature is an ‚ÄúOrgs Filter‚Äù, which will allow users to explore ReFi organizations (ReFi DAO Chapters, the GreenPill Network, Celo Regional DAOs, etc).
- ‚ûï **More Assets & Providers** ‚Äì Continuously adding verified projects to the database.

## üåÄ Team

**Louise** ‚Äì Lead Researcher  
Louise has made significant contributions to **ReFi**, **digital MRV**, and **environmental tokenomics** over the past three years. She has worked with Kolektivo, advises regenerative DAOs, and is co-writing a book on **natural capital production** with Ecofrontiers.

**Pawel** ‚Äì CTO  
A seasoned **full-stack Web3 developer**, Pawel has worked on MVPs and projects such as **PrimeDAO** and **Kolektivo**.

**Pat** ‚Äì Strategy & Product Lead  
Former **Marketing Director of DAOstack** and co-founder of **Curve Labs**, Pat has deep expertise in **DAO strategy and regenerative finance**. He is also co-writing a book on **natural capital production** with Ecofrontiers.

## üìö Resources

üîó **[GitHub](https://github.com/Regen-Atlas)**  
üåê **[Website](https://www.regenatlas.xyz/)**  
üìÑ **[Docs](https://regen-atlas.gitbook.io/regen-atlas-docs)**
‚úíÔ∏è **[Blog](https://paragraph.xyz/@regenatlas)**  
üê¶ **[X](https://x.com/theregenatlas)**  

We deeply appreciate your generosity and support! üôè
